text:
We would like to use mod_cache to cache content served by UserDir (or
/~username/ style locations).  It seems like this could be accomplished by
allowing CacheEnable to be turned off and on inside of <Location> or
<LocationMatch> blocks, or by being able to pass CacheEnable a regular
expression for the path.

We're serving / locally, but fetch user content through a reverse proxy. We
would like to cache commonly requested user content without caching content that
is already local.
creator: liamr@umich.edu

text:
Doesn't
CacheEnable disk /~
work for you?
creator: slive@apache.org
liamr@umich.edu
text:
I hadn't realized you could give it a partial path.  I imagine that /~ should
work fine.  Could the documentation be updated?

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
It says it caches stuff "at or below url-string".  I don't see anything
restricting that to directories.

Feel free to reopen if this doesn't work.
